goals.question: What is the distribution of temperature in the dataset?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the spread of temperature values in the dataset and identify any outliers or patterns.

goals.question: How does the humidity vary with respect to time?
goals.visualization: Line chart of humidity over time
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify any trends or patterns in the humidity levels over time and understand how they vary with respect to different time periods.

goals.question: What is the relationship between wind speed and wind direction?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of wind speed vs wind direction
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the relationship between wind speed and wind direction and identify any patterns or correlations between the two variables.

goals.question: What is the distribution of pressure in the dataset?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the spread of pressure values in the dataset and identify any outliers or patterns.

goals.question: How does the temperature vary with respect to latitude and longitude?
goals.visualization: Heatmap of temperature with respect to latitude and longitude
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify any spatial patterns in the temperature values and understand how they vary with respect to different locations on the map.

code:
import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='temperature', kde=True)
    plt.title('What is the distribution of temperature in the dataset?', wrap=True)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    
    data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], errors='ignore')
    data = data.sort_values(by='date')
    
    sns.lineplot(x='date', y='humidity', data=data)
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    
    plt.title('How does the humidity vary with respect to time?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    sns.scatterplot(x='wind_speed', y='wind_direction', data=data)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.title('What is the relationship between wind speed and wind direction?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='pressure', kde=True)
    plt.title('What is the distribution of pressure in the dataset?', wrap=True)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    heatmap_data = data.pivot_table(index='latitude', columns='longitude', values='temperature')
    sns.heatmap(heatmap_data, cmap='coolwarm')
    plt.title('How does the temperature vary with respect to latitude and longitude?', wrap=True)
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()
